One&Only Palmilla Los Cabos: Complete Resort Guide

Mexico's Most Exclusive Celebrity Retreat

Last updated: January 2025

One&Only Palmilla isn't just a resort—it's where the world's most famous and powerful people disappear when they need a beach vacation. Since 1956, this 250-acre estate on the southern tip of Baja California has hosted everyone from John Wayne to George Clooney to tech billionaires seeking anonymity. The $3,000-12,000+ nightly rates ensure a certain clientele, and the staff is legendary for treating celebrities exactly like everyone else: with impeccable service and complete discretion.

In This Guide

  • Overview & Vibe
  • Accommodations
  • Dining
  • Agua Spa
  • Golf at Palmilla
  • Beach & Pools
  • Activities & Experiences
  • Weddings & Events

  • Booking Tips

Overview & Vibe

{<strong>The Essence of Palmilla:</strong></p><p>One&Only Palmilla occupies a unique position in luxury travel: it's genuinely exclusive without being pretentious. The Mexican colonial architecture, mature palm gardens, and relaxed elegance create an atmosphere that feels like a private estate rather than a hotel.</p><p><strong>Key Stats:</strong></p><ul><li>174 rooms and suites</p><ul><li>250 acres of oceanfront property</p><ul><li>One of few swimmable beaches in Los Cabos</p><ul><li>27-hole Jack Nicklaus golf course</p><ul><li>Opened 1956, acquired by One&Only 2004</p><ul><li>Staff-to-guest ratio: approximately 5:1</p><p><strong>The Vibe:</strong></p><ul><li>Understated wealth (no flashiness)</p><ul><li>Privacy without isolation</p><ul><li>Mexican heritage celebrated authentically</p><ul><li>Multigenerational families alongside honeymooners</p><ul><li>Celebrities blend in (that's the point)</p><p><strong>Who Stays Here:</strong></p><ul><li>A-list celebrities seeking privacy</p><ul><li>Tech executives and founders</p><ul><li>Old money families</p><ul><li>Destination wedding parties (private buyouts)</p><ul><li>Milestone anniversary celebrations}

Accommodations

{<strong>Room Categories:</strong></p><p><strong>Junior Suites (from $3,000/night)</strong></p><ul><li>915 sq ft with private terrace</p><ul><li>Ocean or garden views</p><ul><li>Outdoor rain shower</p><ul><li>King or two queen beds</p><ul><li>Perfect for couples wanting "entry-level" Palmilla</p><p><strong>One Bedroom Ocean Front Suites ($4,500-6,000)</strong></p><ul><li>1,550 sq ft with expansive terrace</p><ul><li>Direct ocean views</p><ul><li>Separate living area</p><ul><li>Outdoor dining space</p><ul><li>Butler service included</p><p><strong>Beach Front Suites ($6,000-8,000)</strong></p><ul><li>Ground level with direct beach access</p><ul><li>Private plunge pool</p><ul><li>Indoor/outdoor living</p><ul><li>Maximum privacy</p><p><strong>Villa One ($15,000-25,000)</strong></p><ul><li>14,000 sq ft private villa</p><ul><li>4 bedrooms, private pool</p><ul><li>Dedicated staff of 8</p><ul><li>Private chef, butler, housekeeper</p><ul><li>Separate gated entrance</p><p><strong>Villa Cortez ($20,000-35,000)</strong></p><ul><li>5 bedrooms, 10,000 sq ft</p><ul><li>Infinity pool overlooking ocean</p><ul><li>Full kitchen with private chef</p><ul><li>Ideal for family reunions, intimate weddings</p><p><strong>What Every Room Includes:</strong></p><ul><li>Twice-daily housekeeping</p><ul><li>Bvlgari amenities</p><ul><li>Nespresso machine</p><ul><li>24-hour room service</p><ul><li>Complimentary minibar (non-alcoholic)</p><ul><li>iPad for resort services}

Dining

{<strong>Restaurants:</strong></p><p><strong>Agua by Jean-Georges</strong> Jean-Georges Vongerichten's only Mexico restaurant. Pacific-Mexican cuisine with Asian influences. The ceviche tasting and lobster tacos are legendary. Dress code enforced.</p><ul><li>Dinner nightly, 6-10pm</p><ul><li>Reservations essential</p><ul><li>$150-250 per person</p><p><strong>Seared</strong> Contemporary steakhouse with premium cuts and ocean views. The tomahawk for two is a signature. Excellent tequila and mezcal selection.</p><ul><li>Dinner nightly</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><ul><li>$120-200 per person</p><p><strong>Breeze</strong> Casual beachfront dining. Mexican classics, fresh seafood, all-day menu. Best sunset views on property.</p><ul><li>Breakfast, lunch, dinner</p><ul><li>No reservations needed</p><ul><li>$50-100 per person</p><p><strong>Suviche</strong> Pool-side Peruvian-Japanese fusion. Excellent ceviches and tiraditos. Light, fresh, perfect for poolside lunch.</p><ul><li>Lunch service</p><ul><li>$40-80 per person</p><p><strong>In-Villa Dining</strong> Full restaurant menus available in your suite or villa. Private chef experiences can be arranged. Many celebrities dine exclusively in-villa.</p><p><strong>Private Dining:</strong></p><ul><li>Beach dinner setups ($2,000+)</p><ul><li>Chef's table experiences</p><ul><li>Wine cellar dinners</p><ul><li>Romantic terrace arrangements}

Agua Spa

{<strong>World-Class Wellness:</strong></p><p>Agua Spa has been ranked among the world's best spas repeatedly. The 25,000 sq ft facility combines ancient Mexican healing traditions with cutting-edge treatments.</p><p><strong>Facilities:</strong></p><ul><li>13 treatment rooms</p><ul><li>Couples suite with private garden</p><ul><li>Watsu pool for aquatic therapy</p><ul><li>Full-service salon</p><ul><li>Fitness center (24-hour)</p><ul><li>Yoga/meditation pavilion</p><ul><li>Steam rooms and saunas</p><p><strong>Signature Treatments:</strong></p><p><strong>Palmilla Purification (3 hours, $750)</strong> Traditional temazcal-inspired journey: body scrub, herbal wrap, massage, and private meditation.</p><p><strong>Desert Rose Ritual (2 hours, $500)</strong> Baja botanicals body treatment with rose quartz massage.</p><p><strong>Watsu Therapy (90 min, $400)</strong> Aquatic bodywork in warm water—transformative for stress release.</p><p><strong>Golf Recovery (90 min, $350)</strong> Targeted massage for golfers, post-round.</p><p><strong>Wellness Programs:</strong></p><ul><li>Multi-day detox retreats</p><ul><li>Private yoga instruction</p><ul><li>Meditation sessions</p><ul><li>Nutritional consultations</p><ul><li>Sleep optimization programs}

Golf at Palmilla

{<strong>Jack Nicklaus Signature Course:</strong></p><p>The 27-hole Palmilla Golf Club is one of Nicklaus's most acclaimed designs. Three distinct 9-hole courses (Mountain, Ocean, Arroyo) combine for various 18-hole configurations.</p><p><strong>The Courses:</strong></p><p><strong>Mountain Nine</strong></p><ul><li>Dramatic elevation changes</p><ul><li>Desert canyon views</p><ul><li>Signature hole: #4 (par 3 over desert wash)</p><p><strong>Ocean Nine</strong></p><ul><li>Stunning Sea of Cortez views</p><ul><li>Clifftop holes</p><ul><li>Signature hole: #5 (par 4 along the coast)</p><p><strong>Arroyo Nine</strong></p><ul><li>Carved through desert arroyos</p><ul><li>Strategic water features</p><ul><li>Technical challenge</p><p><strong>Green Fees (Resort Guests):</strong></p><ul><li>18 holes: $375-450</p><ul><li>Twilight (after 1pm): $275</p><ul><li>Club rental: $100</p><ul><li>Caddie (recommended): $50 + tip</p><p><strong>What Makes It Special:</strong></p><ul><li>Impeccable conditioning</p><ul><li>Never crowded (resort guests priority)</p><ul><li>Forecaddie program for local knowledge</p><ul><li>Practice facility included</p><ul><li>On-course beverage service}

Beach & Pools

{<strong>The Swimmable Beach Advantage:</strong></p><p>Palmilla's beach is one of the few in Los Cabos where you can actually swim. Most Cabos beaches have dangerous currents—Palmilla's protected cove offers calm, clear water.</p><p><strong>Beach Features:</strong></p><ul><li>White sand, swimmable water</p><ul><li>Palapa shade structures</p><ul><li>Full food and beverage service</p><ul><li>Towels, sunscreen provided</p><ul><li>Water sports equipment</p><ul><li>Beach butler service</p><p><strong>Main Pool:</strong></p><ul><li>Infinity edge overlooking ocean</p><ul><li>Generous lounge spacing</p><ul><li>Cabana rentals available</p><ul><li>Never feels crowded</p><ul><li>Full bar and food service</p><p><strong>Adults-Only Pool:</strong></p><ul><li>Quieter atmosphere</p><ul><li>Swim-up bar</p><ul><li>Reserved for 18+</p><p><strong>Villa Pools:</strong></p><ul><li>Private to each villa</p><ul><li>Heated</p><ul><li>Maintained daily</p><p><strong>Water Activities:</strong></p><ul><li>Snorkeling (equipment provided)</p><ul><li>Kayaking</p><ul><li>Paddle boarding</p><ul><li>Fishing charters arranged</p><ul><li>Scuba diving excursions}

Activities & Experiences

{<strong>Resort Activities:</strong></p><p><strong>Complimentary:</strong></p><ul><li>Fitness classes (yoga, Pilates, spinning)</p><ul><li>Tennis courts with equipment</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Beach volleyball</p><ul><li>Croquet lawn</p><ul><li>Stargazing sessions</p><p><strong>Premium Experiences:</strong></p><p><strong>Private Yacht Charter ($3,000-15,000)</strong> Half or full-day excursions. Whale watching (winter), snorkeling at Cabo Pulmo, sunset cruises.</p><p><strong>Sport Fishing ($2,000-5,000)</strong> World-class marlin fishing. The resort works with top captains.</p><p><strong>Cooking Classes ($300)</strong> Mexican cuisine with resort chefs. Market tour available.</p><p><strong>Tequila & Mezcal Education ($150)</strong> Guided tasting with expert sommelier.</p><p><strong>Art Tours ($200)</strong> Guided San José del Cabo gallery walk.</p><p><strong>For Families:</strong></p><ul><li>KidsOnly club (ages 4-11)</p><ul><li>Teen activities program</p><ul><li>Family cooking classes</p><ul><li>Wildlife education programs</p><ul><li>Private movie screenings</p><p><strong>For Couples:</strong></p><ul><li>Couple's spa rituals</p><ul><li>Private beach dinners</p><ul><li>Starlight cinema</p><ul><li>Romance packages}

Weddings & Events

{<strong>Destination Wedding Excellence:</strong></p><p>Palmilla hosts approximately 150 weddings annually, each treated as a private event. The resort can be partially or fully bought out.</p><p><strong>Wedding Venues:</strong></p><ul><li>Chapel overlooking the sea</p><ul><li>Beach ceremonies (up to 200 guests)</p><ul><li>Garden settings</p><ul><li>Restaurant buyouts</p><ul><li>Villa private events</p><p><strong>Wedding Packages Start At:</strong></p><ul><li>Intimate (20 guests): $15,000</p><ul><li>Medium (50 guests): $35,000</p><ul><li>Large (100+ guests): $75,000+</p><ul><li>Full buyout: $500,000+ (multi-day)</p><p><strong>What's Included:</strong></p><ul><li>Dedicated wedding coordinator</p><ul><li>Menu tastings</p><ul><li>Floral design</p><ul><li>Cake</p><ul><li>Photography recommendations</p><ul><li>Guest room blocks</p><p><strong>Celebrity Weddings:</strong> Multiple A-list weddings have occurred here, though the resort never confirms. Privacy is absolute.}

Practical Information

{<strong>Getting There:</strong></p><ul><li>Los Cabos International Airport (SJD): 25 minutes</p><ul><li>Private airport transfers: $250 each way (sedan)</p><ul><li>Helicopter transfers available</p><ul><li>Private aviation: Cabo airport has FBO</p><p><strong>Best Time to Visit:</strong></p><ul><li>Peak season: December-April (dry, warm)</p><ul><li>Whale watching: January-March</p><ul><li>Shoulder season value: May-June, October-November</p><ul><li>Summer: Hot but lower rates</p><p><strong>What to Pack:</strong></p><ul><li>Resort elegant for dinner (no shorts)</p><ul><li>Golf attire if playing</p><ul><li>Swimwear and cover-ups</p><ul><li>Sun protection</p><ul><li>Light layers for desert evenings</p><p><strong>Dress Codes:</strong></p><ul><li>Agua by Jean-Georges: Resort elegant</p><ul><li>Seared: Smart casual</p><ul><li>Breeze/Suviche: Casual</p><ul><li>Pool areas: Swimwear appropriate</p><p><strong>Payment & Policies:</strong></p><ul><li>All major credit cards</p><ul><li>USD and MXN accepted</p><ul><li>Gratuities not included</p><ul><li>Cancellation: 14+ days for full refund</p><ul><li>Minimum stays during peak periods}

Pros & Cons

{<strong>Why Choose One&Only Palmilla:</strong></p><p>✅ <strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>Genuinely swimmable beach (rare in Cabos)</p><ul><li>World-class golf on property</p><ul><li>Jean-Georges restaurant</p><ul><li>Exceptional spa</p><ul><li>Celebrity-level privacy and service</p><ul><li>Beautiful colonial Mexican architecture</p><ul><li>Staff discretion is legendary</p><ul><li>Family-friendly despite luxury positioning</p><ul><li>Protected cove for water activities</p><p>❌ <strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Extremely expensive ($3,000+ minimum)</p><ul><li>Not all-inclusive (meals add up quickly)</p><ul><li>Remote from Cabo San Lucas nightlife (20+ min)</p><ul><li>Golf course fees extra (despite rates)</p><ul><li>Some suites showing age in soft goods</p><ul><li>Limited dining variety (3 main restaurants)</p><ul><li>Peak season availability challenging</p><p><strong>Compared to Alternatives:</strong></p><ul><li>vs. Montage Los Cabos: Palmilla has swimmable beach, Montage has newer design</p><ul><li>vs. Waldorf Astoria Pedregal: Palmilla has golf, Waldorf has dramatic arrival</p><ul><li>vs. Rosewood Mayakoba: Palmilla for beach/golf, Rosewood for lagoon/jungle}

Booking Tips

{<strong>How to Book:</strong></p><p><strong>Best Approach:</strong></p><ol><li>Use a Virtuoso or Amex Fine Hotels travel advisor</p><ol><li>Advisor perks: upgrades, credits, amenities</p><ol><li>Book 4-6 months ahead for peak season</p><ol><li>Direct booking misses advisor benefits</p><p><strong>Money-Saving Strategies:</strong></p><ul><li>May-June offers 30-40% off peak rates</p><ul><li>September-October similar discounts</p><ul><li>Ask about 4th night free promotions</p><ul><li>Book refundable and watch for sales</p><p><strong>Upgrade Tips:</strong></p><ul><li>Travel advisors have upgrade allocation</p><ul><li>Mention celebrations (anniversary, birthday)</p><ul><li>Off-peak arrivals more likely to upgrade</p><ul><li>One&Only loyalty program exists (ask)</p><p><strong>What to Request:</strong></p><ul><li>Ocean-facing suite (worth the premium)</p><ul><li>High floor for views</p><ul><li>Away from construction if any</p><ul><li>Early check-in/late checkout</p><ul><li>Restaurant reservations pre-arrival</p><p><strong>Red Flags to Avoid:</strong></p><ul><li>Booking through discount sites (service differs)</p><ul><li>Peak week arrivals (Christmas, NYE) without advance planning</p><ul><li>Assuming all-inclusive (it's not)}

Frequently Asked Questions

Is One&Only Palmilla worth the price?

If you can comfortably afford it, yes. The combination of swimmable beach (rare in Cabos), world-class golf, exceptional dining, and genuine privacy creates an experience few resorts can match. The value is in the intangibles: discretion, space, and a staff that makes everything effortless.

Will I see celebrities at One&Only Palmilla?

Possibly, but you won't recognize them behaving like celebrities. The resort culture is discretion—famous guests dress casually, dine at normal hours, and blend in. Staff never acknowledges celebrity presence, and photography of other guests is discouraged.

Is Palmilla good for families with children?

Excellent for families who can afford it. The KidsOnly club is well-run, the beach is actually swimmable (huge for families), and multiple room configurations work for families. The atmosphere is relaxed enough for children while maintaining sophistication.

What's the food situation—do I need to budget extra?

Budget significantly extra. This is not all-inclusive. Breakfast averages $50-75/person, lunch $60-100, dinner at Agua $200-300/person with wine. A couple should budget $500-800/day for food and drinks minimum.

How does Palmilla compare to other ultra-luxury Cabos resorts?

Palmilla wins for beach (swimmable), golf (on property), and established reputation. Waldorf Astoria Pedregal offers more dramatic architecture and privacy. Montage has newer facilities. Four Seasons at Costa Palmas is more remote but newer. Palmilla's 70-year legacy is unmatched.
